comments.body: Is there a reason why this wasn't just added to `GotOptions`, instead of creating a new type and extending?
Instead of `any` this should be typed to valid input, something like: `number | TimeoutOptions`
Actually, it seems like this is already covered here, correctly typed.
There I just add semicolon `;` to the end of each line. If this change is redundant I can revert it.
If you want to, you can add yourself to this list. That way you'll be able to help review pull requests to this package in the future ‚ò∫Ô∏è

~~I think need to create separate declaration file for v8 (like in declarations for node.js), because `got v9` works only with `nodejs >= 8` and we should can update previous got version somehow.~~ Ah, I misunderstand first time.

Type 

```ts
string[]
``` 

is used instead of

```ts
Array<'ETIMEDOUT', 'ECONNRESET', ...>
```
because `'ETIMEDOUT', 'ECONNRESET', ...` are just default values. This property can contain custom error codes.

Provided link in description https://github.com/sindresorhus/got/blob/master/source/utils/types.ts#L128 refers to `10.x` version, but this type definition for `9.x`.

`typeof https.request` is `https.ClientRequest` type, but there is [note](https://github.com/sindresorhus/got/tree/v9.6.0#request-1) in `9.x` documentation. 

`request` property is just an object, which contains `gotOptions` property: https://github.com/sindresorhus/got/blob/a45e071e8dc5027ab9c7fad5919195501cd9e9ca/source/request-as-event-emitter.js#L108
I'm sorry. This PR about `options.request`, not `response.request`. Right link to documentation is https://github.com/sindresorhus/got/tree/v9.6.0#request

nit: Maybe add some comment for this? For example

> got's Response is always a "response obtained from http.ClientRequest", therefore these two properties are not `undefined`
